column2: Sotteghem and Sottegem in older English and French language sources) is a municipality located in Belgium and more particularly in Flanders
column3: in the province of East Flanders. The municipality comprises the town of Zottegem proper and the villages of Elene

column14: 373. The total area is 56.66 km² which gives a population density of 470 inhabitants per km².

column1: Zottegem is part of the hilly geographical area of the Flemish Ardennes (Vlaamse Ardennen); the hills and cobblestone streets (Paddestraat) are regular locations in the springtime cycle classics of Flanders. The city is known for its ties with Lamoral
column2: Count of Egmont; Lamoral has a castle (Egmontkasteel)
column3: a museum (Egmontkamer) and two statues in the centre of Zottegem. He is buried in a crypt (Egmontcrypte) under the church. Leeuwergem castle in Elene is an 18th-century stately home; Breivelde castle in Grotenberge is surrounded by an English landscape garden. The archaeological museum in Velzeke exhibits findings from Gallo-Roman culture.
